node.title: 'The public have no idea': Australian nurses reveal the true extent of burnout in the workforce
node.alt: A masked nurse adjusts their blue plastic glove in an operation room.
node.description: Across the country nurses are burnt out, exhausted and looking for new jobs, saying COVID-19 has only exacerbated workload pressures and staffing issues that existed long before the pandemic. Here's a look at the state of the workforce.
node.content:
["Across Australia, nurses are burnt\u00a0out.\u00a0", "In the two years of the pandemic, they've been on the front lines of every aspect of the COVID-19 response:\u00a0testing, tracing, screening, isolating, vaccinating and treating the disease.", "That doesn't take into account the existing non-COVID-related work, a backlog of which continues to build up.", "With no respite and ever-increasing demand, nurses across the country \u2014 and across both public and private systems \u2014 told us they're feeling stretched to the limit.", "
States are expected to lose 'significant' numbers to burnout
", "Annie Butler, the federal secretary of the Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation, says \"the issue of burnout is absolutely real\".", "\"Particularly in Victoria after the second wave last year, the experience in private aged care, it was devastating,\" she said.", "Ms Butler says there's a lot of trepidation\u00a0about the future.", "President of the Australian College of Nursing, Christine Duffield, says it's likely states will lose \"significant numbers\" of nurses to burnout.", "\"They're tired. It's been really\u00a0tough putting on all of that equipment, dealing with lots of difficult situations and families that can't get in to see their relatives and things.", "\"I think that we'll see nurses who've had great skills ... that could well be recruited out into other industries, but I think some nurses will decide that it's just been too stressful, and they'll move on.\"", "
So, do we have enough nurses to meet demand?
", "It's hard to say.", "The number of registered nurses in Australia continues to increase year on year,\u00a0even across the pandemic.", "", "
Datawrapper chart: Increase in RNs from December 2019 to June 2021(ABC News)
", "But it's unclear whether\u00a0there is enough to meet the ever-increasing demand. Patient turnover has increased, there has been a reduction in hospital beds, there is an ageing population and chronic disease \u2014 topped off by the pressures brought by the COVID pandemic.", "The most recent\u00a0modelling\u00a0on supply and demand in the nursing workforce was carried out in 2014 by federal health body Health Workforce Australia (HWA), which was abolished that same year.", "It predicted an overall shortfall\u00a0of 85,000 nurses by 2025\u00a0and 123,000 by 2030 under the then-current settings, as well as\u00a0shortfalls across all sectors:\u00a0acute, aged care, critical care, emergency and mental health.", "But in a scenario that modelled\u00a0improved retention of nursing students, improved employment rates after graduation\u00a0and increased early career retention \u2014 as well as assuming that slower future economic growth will slow provision of health services and consequently demand for nurses \u2014 the shortfalls reduced to 39,000 by 2025 and 45,000 by 2030.", "", "
Predicted nursing workforce supply and demand by 2025 and 2030.(ABC News)
", "Under that scenario, the report predicted supply of the entire nursing workforce across all sectors would be 300,398 by 2025.\u00a0As of June 2021,\u00a0the number of registered and enrolled nurses\u00a0was 420,553 \u2014 already 40\u00a0per cent higher than\u00a02025 predictions.", "The 2014 modelling obviously didn't\u00a0account\u00a0for record economic growth, a pandemic or Australia's recent recession.", "But there has been no modelling on this since 2014 and the Department of Health says \"no further information regarding the [2014] report can be provided\".", "In a response to the ABC,\u00a0a spokesperson said the department had commenced a new study in September 2021\u00a0and that it was expected to be published \"in the second half of 2022\".", "\"The study will take recent data (from 2015 to 2020) to quantify the nursing workforce in Australia and include future scenario projections of workforce requirements at the national and state and territory level,\" a spokesperson said.", "On a broader scale, seasonally adjusted estimates by the Australian Bureau of Statistics showed 333,700 total job vacancies for the August 2021 quarter\u00a0\u2014 down 9.8 per cent from May.", "In contrast to the general trend, vacancies in the \"health care and social assistance\"\u00a0industry increased from 8.2 per cent to 21.2 per cent between February 2020 and August 2021.", "The top two reasons for those vacancies \u2014 across industry \u2014 were replacement/resignation and increased workload.", "
Nursing shortages are a problem globally
", "A 2020 report\u00a0from the International Council of Nurses\u00a0found 90 per cent of national nurse associations said they were somewhat or extremely concerned that heavy workloads, insufficient resources, burnout and stress related to the pandemic were causing more nurses to leave the profession or at least to want to leave the profession.", "Among the\u00a0OECD countries\u00a0Australia has one of the higher numbers of nurses per 1,000 people, trailing only Switzerland, Norway, Iceland and Germany. In this ranking, \"nurses\" are defined as all \"practising\" nurses providing direct health services.", "", "
Column chart shows the number\u00a0of nurses per 1,000 inhabitants in 2019 across the OECD countries.(ABC News)
", "In the US and the UK, healthcare systems\u00a0are feeling significant strain from a workforce shortage\u00a0that has been exacerbated by the gruelling demands of\u00a0COVID-19.", "In the US, a fourth wave has seen nurses\u00a0quitting their jobs in substantial numbers\u00a0and a UK\u00a0government report has found National Healthcare Service\u00a0(NHS) staff burnout is at \"emergency\" level, risking the future of the service.", "", "
The ICN says filling the workforce gap\u00a0is important if we are to\u00a0build\u00a0resilience against future pandemics.(Reuters: Shannon Stapleton)
", "
Are graduates the answer?
", "One way of filling the shortage gap, the ICN suggests, is to increase the number of nursing students and make sure those students are able to get meaningful employment after graduation.", "In Australia, the number of students\u00a0graduating nursing at university continues to increase.\u00a0But not all graduates go on to work as registered nurses.", "In 2020, 88.8 per cent of graduates from\u00a0undergraduate-level nursing courses were employed around four months after graduating, according to the Department of Education, Skills and Employment.", "\"In addition, 13 per cent were working in non-professional level roles as health and welfare support workers, an occupation grouping which includes jobs such as enrolled nurses, aged and disabled carers, and nursing support and personal care workers.\"", "But Professor Duffield says we\u00a0can't rely on graduates alone to staff hospitals and bolster the workforce. She says we need more\u00a0highly skilled, experienced nurses.", "To do that, Professor Duffield says students shouldn't focus as heavily on graduate positions in hospitals, but instead look elsewhere to build up their experience.", "\"We have an oversupply of new graduates\u00a0but they don't go where they're needed, so they all want to work in a large teaching hospital\u00a0in a big city, in\u00a0an urban area and our shortage is our rural and remote areas,\" she said.", "Health Workforce data from 2019 shows nurses are most needed in small rural towns where there are the fewest full-time equivalent registered nurses per 100,000 people.\u00a0", "", "
Bar chart shows the geographical distribution of full-time-equivalent RNs in Australia per 100,000 in 2019.(ABC News)
", "
Are more foreign workers the answer?\u00a0
", "Australia has always relied heavily on nurses from overseas.", "Of the OECD countries, data collected from 2017-2018 showed only Switzerland and New Zealand were more reliant on foreign-trained workers.", "", "
Column chart shows percentage of foreign-trained nurses in OECD countries across 2017-2018.(ABC News)
", "The number of employed registered nurses born overseas has increased 32\u00a0per cent since 2014.", "And of those nurses born overseas, the Philippines, India and the United Kingdom were the top three contributors.\u00a0\u00a0", "More than 500,000 temporary migrants have left Australia since the borders shut in March 2020,\u00a0according to\u00a0a report by a\u00a0parliamentary committee on migration.", "But\u00a0with the border\u00a0now re-opening, there are calls for the government to fast-track\u00a0visas for foreign nurses.", "Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt has flagged a move to approve 2,000 overseas nurses and doctors for work in Australia, as part of a plan aiming\u00a0to ease the healthcare staffing crisis.", "But that plan has not been officially announced, and the Health Department could not\u00a0provide the ABC with any detail on\u00a0how the figure of 2,000 was arrived at, or how they might be split between professions.", "
What effect could a shortage be having on our COVID response?
", "One indication is a recent survey of all 194 Intensive Care Units across Australia which revealed there are 195 fewer available ICU beds than there were in 2020.", "At the time of the survey, published in October this year, 2,183 staffed ICU beds were available.", "In March 2020 there were 2,378 fully staffed ICU beds, configured and equipped to ICU standards, with a maximum surge capacity of 4,258 additional beds in a potential disaster scenario.", "While there was a drop in available beds across all states and territories, the decline was most prominent in rural, regional and private ICUs.\u00a0", "\"Fewer than half the potentially additional physical ICU beds could be opened with currently available staff levels while maintaining pre-pandemic models of care,\" the study said.", "The survey analysis found the decrease in available beds was due to a lack of staff, particularly registered nurses. This was also the factor most likely to limit the potential of ICUs to surge in response to the pandemic.", "
Will there be more government funding?
", "", "
Scott Morrison argues the states have had 18 months to prepare for COVID-19 surges in hospitals.(AAP: Dan Himbrechts)
", "Not from the federal government.", "In a joint letter to federal Health Minister Greg Hunt sent in September, all eight state and territory health ministers asked for \"immediate additional Commonwealth funding\" ahead of borders reopening.", "\"States and territories are under unrelenting strain due to the current COVID-19 demands and the pre-existing trend of increased hospital activity,\" the letter said.", "But the\u00a0government has remained steadfast that it will not be\u00a0increasing hospital funding.", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison has repeatedly ruled it out, saying the states have had \"a lot of\u00a0opportunity to prepare for this\"."]
